learning_outcomes.description: Use an ethical, evidence-based, and clinically governed approach to select a digital health intervention in various settings.
Analyse the stakeholder perspectives, barriers, and facilitators of digital health interventions on local and organisational levels
Lead an evidence-based digital health intervention specific to your own context
Evaluate the clinical, business, and technological processes of various digital health initiatives and settings

assessments.task_description:
This assessment starts the process of you designing an implementation plan for a digital health intervention in a healthcare setting of your choice. You will demonstrate your understanding of the challenges faced by the existing healthcare setting and how digital health can address these challenges.

Individually, you will create: a 100-word introduction outlining the healthcare setting of your choice and the planned digital health intervention; a 10-item annotated bibliography; a 300-word synthesis of the evidence (from the 10 studies selected previously) and problem statement. Your problem statement will define a challenge faced by the healthcare setting that can be addressed by your digital health intervention. Discuss why this problem needs to be addressed and how it will advance the Quintuple aim of healthcare.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment should be uploaded electronically using Turn-it-in through the course Blackboard site. A submission portal will be made available via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
You are to work individually to prepare a Project Management and Plan for Implementation (PMPI). A PMPI is a multiple page document that clearly outlines the implementation strategy. The report includes written sections that outline various strategies and summaries of assessments that have been/will be undertaken. Part 1 of the assessment covers topics discussed in the first part of the course including implementation framework, governance, privacy and ethical considerations, and user-centred design. Part 2 of the assessment covers topics discussed in the second part of the course including stakeholder engagement, budget and procurement, and monitoring and evaluation plan.

You are strongly encouraged to continue with the digital health intervention submitted for assessment from earlier in the course. Changes to the digital health intervention and healthcare setting can be discussed with the course coordinator on an individual basis.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment should be uploaded electronically using Turn-it-in through the course Blackboard site. A submission portal will be made available via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
30/10/2025

Presentation completed live online. Following your presentation, you will be asked to join a breakout room and show your ID (e.g. student ID, driver's license, passport) for identity verification purposes. The pitch will be held during class time between10am-12pm.
assessments.task_description:
Throughout this course, you have been developing the knowledge and skills to implement a digital health intervention in a healthcare service. This assessment is an opportunity for you to apply your understanding of the course content to a setting specific to you in an oral pitch. In this task, you are pitching to the operational unit where your digital health implementation will theoretically take place. For example, if you are introducing an ieMR dashboard for patients undergoing lung transplant, your operational unit would likely be the clinician’s part of the transplant team. Ensure that your presentation is targeted and addresses the specific needs for your audience.

You are to work individually to prepare a 5-minute oral pitch that builds on your existing knowledge and research from your previous assessments. You will present as the first part of a live team presentation together with your COMP3820 ‘development team’ (you will still need to submit the corresponding slides). Your presentation will be followed by a question-and-answer session and identity verification.

The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Slides or visual presentation resources should be uploaded electronically using Turn-it-in through the course Blackboard site. A submission portal will be made available via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.assessment_title: Digital workbooks for each module, including digital health intervention proposal
assessments.due_date:
4/08/2025 - 20/10/2025

Workbooks will be due every Monday from Week 2 - Week 12.
assessments.task_description: Each week's digital workbook will contain activities for you to show your understanding of the corresponding learning module and to contribute your personal opinions and experiences in digital health. The second digital workbook includes your digital health intervention proposal. Individually, you will create a 250-word proposal outlining the healthcare setting of your choice, the problem statement, and the proposed digital health intervention. This proposal will be used to match you to COMP3820 students developing a software prototype for your intervention.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Workbooks should be uploaded electronically using Turn-it-in through the course Blackboard site. A submission portal will be made available via Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
